meanings.definition: Persuading someone to do something by using excessive or forceful tactics.
meanings.sent1: She kept overpersuading her friend to go to the party, even though he didn't want to.
meanings.sent2: He was overpersuading his parents to buy him a new toy.
meanings.sent3: The salesman was overpersuading the customer to buy the most expensive item in the store.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of overpersuading voters with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The coach was overpersuading the team to give their best performance in the upcoming match.

meanings.definition: To convince someone to agree to something through persistent argument or pressure.
meanings.sent1: After much overpersuading, she finally agreed to join the hiking trip.
meanings.sent2: He was overpersuading his classmates to choose his idea for the project.
meanings.sent3: The children were overpersuading their parents to let them have a pet elephant.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was overpersuading the students to participate in the school play.
meanings.sent5: The manager was overpersuading the team to work overtime to meet the deadline.
